question.text: Arrange these hominids in ascending order of their cranial capacities.

options.text: Java man  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Homo habilis  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Neanderthal man
Homo habilis <math><mo>→</mo></math> Java man <math><mo>→</mo></math> Neanderthal man
Neanderthal man  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Homo habilis  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Java man
Homo habilis  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Neanderthal man  <math><mo>→</mo></math>  Java man

solution.text: The first hominid was called Homo habilis and his cranial capacity was between 650 and 800cc. Homo erectus, whose fossils were discovered in Java, had a large brain with a cranial capacity of around 900cc. The Neanderthal man had a cranial capacity of 1400cc and lived near east and central Asia.
